name: Restrict EventBridge event bus access to known principals
description: Ensure that the AWS EventBridge event bus is not exposed to everyone. Configure the event bus policy to allow access only from known and authorized AWS accounts, IAM roles, or services.

name: Limit cross-account access for EventBridge event buses
description: Ensure that AWS EventBridge event buses do not allow unknown cross-account access for delivery of events. Explicitly define and limit the AWS accounts that are allowed to put events on the event bus using resource-based policies.

name: Enable event replication for EventBridge global endpoints
description: Enable event replication for Amazon EventBridge global endpoints to ensure high availability and disaster recovery across multiple regions. This allows events to be replicated to secondary regions in case of a regional outage.

name: Restrict cross-account access for EventBridge schema registries
description: Ensure that AWS EventBridge schema registries do not allow unknown cross-account access. Configure resource-based policies to explicitly define and limit the AWS accounts that are allowed to access and use the schema registries.

name: Use AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMK) for EventBridge rule encryption
description: Encrypt EventBridge rules using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMK) instead of AWS managed keys. This provides more control over the encryption keys and allows for fine-grained access control and auditing of key usage.

name: Implement least privilege access for EventBridge resources
description: Ensure that IAM policies for EventBridge follow the principle of least privilege. Grant only the necessary permissions to authorized entities for managing and interacting with EventBridge resources such as event buses, rules, and targets.

name: Enable logging for EventBridge API calls
description: Enable AWS CloudTrail logging specifically for EventBridge API calls to track and monitor all actions performed on EventBridge resources. This helps in auditing and troubleshooting EventBridge-related activities.

name: Use HTTPS endpoints for EventBridge API calls and targets
description: Ensure that all API calls to EventBridge and all target endpoints configured in EventBridge rules use HTTPS (TLS) for secure communication. This prevents potential eavesdropping or man-in-the-middle attacks.

name: Implement tagging for EventBridge resources
description: Apply consistent and meaningful tags to all EventBridge resources including event buses, rules, and targets. This facilitates better organization, cost allocation, and access control management of EventBridge resources.

name: Use dead-letter queues for failed event processing
description: Configure dead-letter queues (DLQ) for EventBridge rules to capture and handle events that fail to be delivered to their targets. This ensures that no events are lost and allows for analysis and reprocessing of failed events.

name: Implement input transformation for sensitive data in events
description: Use EventBridge input transformation to remove or mask sensitive data in events before they are sent to targets. This helps prevent exposure of confidential information in logs or downstream systems.

name: Regularly review and audit EventBridge rules and targets
description: Implement a process to regularly review and audit EventBridge rules and their associated targets. This helps ensure that all rules are still relevant, targets are valid and secure, and no unauthorized changes have been made to the event routing configuration.
